name: Prenzlauer Berg close to Mauerpark
space: In the summertime we are spending most of our weekends in our little house in our garden and want to use the opportunity to rent a room in our cosy 2 bedroom apartment. But we might also stay in the other room. We will be very happy to give you tips on things to do and see in Berlin and make sure your stay runs smoothly. The room is about 25 square meters and is located on the 2nd floor. The bed measures 180 cm x 200 cm and is fitted with a kapok futon, which is a hard-ish mattress but which we find very pleasant to sleep on. The bakery next door is open everyday from up 7 am, which makes warm croissants for breakfast very tempting. On Sundays don't miss the traditional flea markets on Arkonaplatz and in the nearby Mauerpark for special treats and souvenirs.  check out our  travel guide and please let us know what your highlights were so we can add them for future guests

And I have to ask you to keep also the common german house-rules like no noise after 8:00 PM / 20:00 hrs.  Please do not disturb the neighbours, specially in the evening and night. As I am a "green" person I have to ask you not to waste energy, water and paper. I think also following generations will need the sources and enjoy the wood.
interaction: I'm working as a freelancing photographer. My main topic is Berlin, its  architectur, people, and art. Usually I am informed what on in the very moment.   But I work also on travels for reportage. In former years I was working as TV-journalist, web-content-editor, designer of graphics, exhibitions, websites and audio-vision.   I have to work at home, because I'm handicaped in the moment due to a botched surgery when I've got a new artificial knee. Therefor I am not able to walk properly - specially steps. In the flat it's ok now and outside I still need my wheelchair.  So if you like to help me from time to time to take down trashbags this would be a great help for me.  I am very thankful for your understanding. I love Berlin, it's many varieties of culture, and can tell you a lot about it.  I also travelled a lot and have high interest in world-culture and world-music, besides of R&B, classic and moderate Jazz. There are a lot of things to do in Berlin, which I appreciate very much.

Also at a stone's throw away is an old (but renovated) brewery area with Clubs, Theater and Cinema. In every street is more than one "Späti" the famous late night stores for food, tobacco, drinks and more.. If you have children you will be amazed about the many playgrounds!

house_rules: Please take good care of everything during your stay!  I attach great importance to cleanliness and will pass the guestroom and some other facilities in the best condition to you. I expect that in return! A few house-rules: 1. Take off the shoes in the apartment. Use your slippers! 2. Don't host other guests without my prior approval. 3. Please turn off any light that you are not using. 4. Use water responsibly, don't waste it arbitrary. 5. Please put the heating down when you leave the apartment during the day. 6. Please ensure regular and adequate room aeration. 7. This is a non-smoking apartment. 8. Volume: Since the apartment is in a normal residential house and in the interests of good neighborly relations, I ask you to adjust the volume in the evenings/nights accordingly. Loud parties are not allowed! THANK YOU VERY MUCH!
host_about:
I'm a creative person, adventurer, and traveler and always looking forward to my next trip! I love beaches, palm trees and out of the way places. 
Morocco, Portugal and Spain have become my favorite destinations and I prefer staying with local people so I really have a chance to learn about the area I am visiting. 
I am easy going and love making new friends! I love Yoga and fitness. I enjoy mindful and easy conversation and like to stretch a point.
I speak English, a little Spanish and a little French but found that communication is never a big problem as long as you trust in speaking gestures.
As one of the most experienced Airbnb Superhosts in Berlin I know how to be a mindful guest.
When I am at home and slip into the role of a host I am looking forward to welcoming you in my guestroom here in Prenzlauer Berg.

-there are no strangers .. just friends you haven't met yet-

neighborhood_overview: Description: A stone's throw away you'll find the Viktoria-Park, for Berlin people known as the "Kreuzberg", with a lovely waterfall. An oasis of relaxation with a very nice and large children's playground next to a little Biergarten (Golgatha) and a high monument from where - weather permitting - you can enjoy a spectacular view over the city. The Bergmannstraße with it's many cafés, bars, restaurants, second hand shops is just a couple of walking minutes away. There are wine dealers, supermarkets, pharmacies and one of the three last remaining historical market halls in Berlin. South of Bergmannstraße in the small side streets (Chamisso Platz) you'll think you've gone back to centuries past: Cobblestone streets and Wilhelminian style tenements with stucco decorations. The closest supermarkets are Kaisers (corner Großbeerenstraße), ALDI, Lidl  and Getränke Hoffmann on the western end of Kreuzbergstraße. The Kaiser´s supermarket in Bergmannstraße is even open until midnight (mon-sat).
transit: The next metro station is Yorckstrasse. host_about: I live and work in Windhoek, Namibia. I am a part-time Yoga Instructor. I enjoy travelling to exotic destinations when time permits. My all time favourite book: The Hobbit - must read. Life motto - One Life - live it well.  I bought this property to have a base in Europe. I have chosen Berlin because it is vibrant, full of energy, very individual, still embrace a rather hedonistic approach to life considering it is one of the main capital cities of Europe. The sub-culture, the art-scene- poor but sexy, a village feel yet with all the fantastic facilities that a city can offer. Most of all, Berlin changes its face with every moving second, yet, Berlin remains Berlin deep at heart. Where better place than the heart of the former Eastern Part of Berlin, Prenslauerberg? East West fusion manifests itself when you least expect. Mostly subtle but from time to time, as plain as the nose on one's face. The sub-culture is usually only perceivable after a fair stay in Berlin.
